Models¶

class bambu.blog.models.Category(*args, **kwargs)¶

A category under which blog posts can be filed

name = None¶

The category name

post_percent¶

The percentage of total blog posts that are in this category

slug = None¶

The category slug (unique)

class bambu.blog.models.Post(*args, **kwargs)¶

A blog post

class QuerySet(model=None, query=None, using=None)¶

A custom queryset that adds a few utility functions to the standard one

css(rendered=False)¶

Returns rendered CSS for all of the posts in the query

live()¶

Returns only posts in the future that are marked as published

Post.attachments¶

The attachments (images and other media) attached to the post (optional)

Post.author¶

The auth.User that wrote the post

Post.body = None¶

The body of the post. By default this is a plain text field within the admin, but you can install django-markitup or django-tinymce and the admin will automatically detect one of those apps. Regardless of textbox interface, the body is always run through PyQuery’s HTML parser, in order to generate a viable, readable excerpt that ignores references to things like oEmbed resources and images, and flattens lists, headings, quotes etc

Post.broadcast = None¶

Whether a webhook event was fired when the post was published

Post.categories¶

The categories assigned to the post (optional)

Post.comments¶

A generic link to a comment model, as defined in the BLOG_COMMENTS_MODEL setting

Post.css = None¶

Custom CSS for the post (great for making custom-designed pages for each post)

Post.date = None¶

The post date

Post.excerpt = None¶

A short, automatically-generated excerpt for the post

Post.featured_attachment()¶

Returns the first attachment for the post, that’s marked as Featured

Post.next_post()¶

Returns the next blog post in the sequence (irrespective of category, tag or author)

Post.previous_post()¶

Returns the previous blog post in the sequence (irrespective of category, tag or author)

Post.published = None¶

Whether the post is published (True by default)

Post.render_css()¶

Runs CSS through Django’s templating engine, allowing you to write CSS that references attachment URLs and the post ID without actually having to know that they are

Post.slug = None¶

The slug of the post (if no title is given, a slug is generated from the total count of blog posts

Post.tags = <taggit.managers._TaggableManager object at 0xafbf54c>¶

The tags assigned to the post (optional)

Post.title = None¶

The title of the post (optional)

class bambu.blog.models.PostUpload(*args, **kwargs)¶

A temporary holding place for media uploaded via XML-RPC

convert_to_attachment(post)¶

Converts the temporary uploaded file into an attachment

Managers¶

class bambu.blog.managers.PostManager¶

A custom manager for the blog.Post model
